metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19604 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Arbitrary command execution is possible in Git before 2.20.2, 2.21.x before 2.21.1, 2.22.x before 2.22.2, 2.23.x before 2.23.1, and 2.24.x before 2.24.1 because a "git submodule update" operation can run commands found in the .gitmodules file of a malicious repository.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-all - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-cvs - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-daemon-run - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-daemon-sysvinit - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-el - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-email - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-gui - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-man - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-mediawiki - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-svn - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
gitk - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
gitweb - 2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4').
